sub_topic: Probability of a certain medical condition occurring
message_1: In a population of 10,000 people, it is known that 3% have a certain medical condition. What is the probability that a randomly selected individual from this population has the medical condition?
message_2: The probability that a randomly selected individual from this population has the medical condition is 3% or 0.03. This is because 3% of the population has the condition, so the chance of selecting someone with the condition is 3 out of 100.
